sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a formation reaction
message_1:
Calculate the standard enthalpy change (∆H°) for the formation of ammonia (NH3) at 298 K using the following data: 

N2(g) + 3H2(g) → 2NH3(g)  ∆H° = −92.4 kJ/mol 

Hint: Standard enthalpy change (∆H°) for a reaction is calculated by taking the sum of the standard enthalpies of the products minus the sum of the standard enthalpies of the reactants.
message_2:
The given balanced chemical equation is:

N2(g) + 3H2(g) → 2NH3(g)  ∆H° = −92.4 kJ/mol

To calculate the standard enthalpy change (∆H°) for the formation of ammonia (NH3) at 298 K, we can use the given ∆H° value directly since it is already provided for the balanced equation.

∆H° = -92.4 kJ/mol

This means that the standard enthalpy change for the formation of ammonia (NH3) at 298 K is -92.4 kJ/mol.
